chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
orig_base_params: BaseParams
orig_multi_params: MultiParams orig_base_params
orig_failure_params: FailureParams orig_multi_params
data_serializer: Serializer data
name_serializer: Serializer name
msg_serializer: Serializer msg
input_serializer: Serializer input
snapshot_interval: nat

Goal:
forall x y : log_files, {x = y} + {x <> y}

Premises:
name = fun (P : BaseParams) (MultiParams0 : MultiParams P) => let (name, msg, _, _, nodes, _, _, _, _, _) := MultiParams0 in name : forall P : BaseParams, MultiParams P -> Type Arguments name {P MultiParams}
Record BaseParams : Type := Build_BaseParams { data : Type; input : Type; output : Type } Arguments Build_BaseParams (_ _ _)%type_scope
Record Serializer (A : Type) : Type := Build_Serializer { serialize : A -> IOStreamWriter.t; deserialize : ByteListReader.t A; serialize_deserialize_id : serialize_deserialize_id_spec serialize deserialize } Arguments Serializer _%type_scope Arguments Build_Serializer [A]%type_scope _%function_scope [deserialize] _%function_scope
Inductive log_files : Set := Count : log_files | Snapshot : log_files | Log : log_files
Record MultiParams (P : BaseParams) : Type := Build_MultiParams { name : Type; msg : Type; msg_eq_dec : forall x y : msg, {x = y} + {x <> y}; name_eq_dec : forall x y : name, {x = y} + {x <> y}; nodes : list name; all_names_nodes : forall n : name, In n nodes; no_dup_nodes : NoDup nodes; init_handlers : name -> data; net_handlers : name -> name -> msg -> data -> list output * data * list (name * msg); input_handlers : name -> input -> data -> list output * data * list (name * msg) } Arguments Build_MultiParams _ [name msg]%type_scope (_ _)%function_scope [nodes]%list_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _ _)%function_scope
data = fun BaseParams0 : BaseParams => let (data, _, _) := BaseParams0 in data : BaseParams -> Type Arguments data {BaseParams}
Record FailureParams (P0 : BaseParams) (P : MultiParams P0) : Type := Build_FailureParams { reboot : data -> data } Arguments FailureParams {P0} Arguments Build_FailureParams [P0] _ _%function_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope

msg = fun (P : BaseParams) (MultiParams0 : MultiParams P) => let (name, msg, _, _, nodes, _, _, _, _, _) := MultiParams0 in msg : forall P : BaseParams, MultiParams P -> Type Arguments msg {P MultiParams}
file_name_eq_dec : forall x y : file_name, {x = y} + {x <> y} where ?P : [orig_base_params : BaseParams orig_multi_params : MultiParams orig_base_params orig_failure_params : FailureParams orig_multi_params data_serializer : Serializer data name_serializer : Serializer name msg_serializer : Serializer msg input_serializer : Serializer input snapshot_interval : nat |- BaseParams] ?DiskOpMultiParams : [orig_base_params : BaseParams orig_multi_params : MultiParams orig_base_params orig_failure_params : FailureParams orig_multi_params data_serializer : Serializer data name_serializer : Serializer name msg_serializer : Serializer msg input_serializer : Serializer input snapshot_interval : nat |- DiskOpMultiParams ?P]
